congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation
Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 37, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 187 noes, Roll No. 76.<P/>H. Res. 74, the rule providing for consideration of the joint resolutions (H.J. Res. 36) and (H.J. Res. 37) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to D106190 noes, Roll No. 75, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 74.

The House passed H.J. Res. 37, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 187 noes, Roll No. 76.<P/>H. Res. 74, the rule providing for consideration of the joint resolutions (H.J. Res. 36) and (H.J. Res. 37) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to D106190 noes, Roll No. 75, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 74.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.

Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation

Res. 37) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to D106190 noes, Roll No. 75, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 74.

The House passed H.J. Res. 37, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation, by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 187 noes, Roll No. 76.<P/>H. Res. 74, the rule providing for consideration of the joint resolutions (H.J. Res. 36) and (H.J. Res. 37) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to D106190 noes, Roll No. 75, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 74.

congVote.result: The joint resolution (H.J. Res. 38) was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 54 yeas to 45 nays (Vote No. 43), Senate passed H.J. Res. 38, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of the Interior known as the Stream Protection Rule.

titleInfo.title: United States Senate Joint Resolution 10 (115th Congress)
United States House Joint Resolution 38 (115th Congress)
United States House Joint Resolution 38 (115th Congress)
MOTION TO PROCEED TO EXECUTIVE SESSION

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO PROCEED TO EXECUTIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 18

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of the nomination of Jeff Sessions, of Alabama, to be Attorney General.<P/>A motion was entered to close further debate on the nomination, and, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, a vote on cloture will occur upon disposition of the nomination of Elisabeth Prince DeVos, of Michigan, to be Secretary of Education.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this nomination, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 53 yeas to 45 nays (Vote No. 44), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Executive Session to consider the nomination.

extension.searchTitle: EXECUTIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 18

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of the nomination of Thomas Price, of Georgia, to be Secretary of Health and Human Services.<P/>A motion was entered to close further debate on the nomination, and, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, a vote on cloture will occur upon disposition of the nomination of Jeff Sessions, of Alabama, to be Attorney General.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this nomination, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 47 nays (Vote No. EX. 45), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 46), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Executive Session to consider the nomination.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of the nomination of Steven T. Mnuchin, of California, to be Secretary of the Treasury.<P/>A motion was entered to close further debate on the nomination, and, in accordance with the provisions of Rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, a vote on cloture will occur upon disposition of the nomination of Thomas Price, of Georgia, to be Secretary of Health and Human Services.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this nomination, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 52 yeas to 47 nays (Vote No. EX. 47), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 48), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Executive Session to consider the nomination.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: SEC Resource Extraction Resolution of Disapproval_Agreement
SEC Resource Extraction Resolution of Disapproval_Agreement
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 41, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers'', after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 52 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 50), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.

Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 41, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers'', after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 52 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 50), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this measure, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 52 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. EX. 49), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.
